intro: Echium spinescens, commonly known as the spiked thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Echium spinescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
